title: K-Star Securities Underwriter
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. KKR REAL ESTATE
KKR Real Estate is a global provider of equity and debt capital across real estate investment strategies. Real estate has been a part of the firm’s strategy since 1981 when we first began pursuing real estate opportunities through our private equity strategy. In 2011, we made a decision to form a dedicated real estate platform believing that a dedicated real estate team with access to KKR’s global investment platform, could create differentiated deal flow and generate compelling risk-adjusted returns for our investors. As of March 31, 2023, our team consists of 155+ dedicated investment and asset management professionals across 11 countries, with more than ~$65 billion of assets under management.
REAL ESTATE CREDIT OVERVIEW
KKR Real Estate Credit, formed in January 2015, invests in real estate credit products, and complements KKR Real Estate’s private equity platforms. Within KKR Real Estate Credit, we seek opportunities where we have a sourcing, underwriting or execution advantage by leveraging KKR’s brand, industry knowledge and relationships. KKR Real Estate Credit currently invests through six separately capitalized vehicles across our Direct Lending and Securities portfolios and consists of 50+ dedicated professionals based in New York, Dallas, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Houston, and London.
KKR has developed a dedicated services platform, K-Star Asset Management LLC (“K-Star”) to support loan origination, securities investing, asset management, risk management and client experience for KKR Real Estate Credit.
POSITION OVERVIEW
K-Star is seeking to hire an investment professional to join its industry-leading real estate credit franchise. The qualified candidate will be responsible for the review and underwrite of loans underlying commercial mortgage-backed securities on behalf of KKR Real Estate Credit’s various investment vehicles and strategies. The candidate must have exceptional analytical, communication, and presentation skills, and the ability to build strong partnerships across the various KKR businesses, including the firm’s real estate credit originations, investment, legal, finance, and asset management teams.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze, interpret and underwrite complex real estate loans and securities of all commercial asset classes in compliance within KKR’s risk guidelines.
Conduct detailed economic and demographic research to assess risk.
Analyze and utilize various source documents, which may include but are not limited to property operating statements, budgets, rent rolls, and third-party reports.
Determine underwriting assumptions through discussions with third party brokers and other market participants.
Monitor national, regional, and local market dynamics to assess tenant credit risks and concentrations.
Prepare, present, and discuss underwriting results to management and other stakeholders, in a collaborative roundtable environment.
Participate and present in working session meetings, investment committees, and portfolio roundtable reviews.
Assist team with reporting requirements and other portfolio management work streams.
Work collaboratively with colleagues within K-Star (including Underwriting Analysts) and KKR Real Estate Credit’s organizational structure.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, preferably in a related course of study
Minimum of seven years of related work experience in underwriting of loans secured by commercial real estate is preferred.
Fundamental knowledge of commercial real estate, fixed income, and general financial concepts
Superior analytical, valuation and financial modeling skills
Excellent organizational, verbal, and communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail and thoroughness is required to ensure accuracy in all data and work product
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Team Player with collaborative and strong relationship building skills, but also must be a self-starter and have the ability to work independently
Skilled at developing and maintaining personal, social and business relationships representing KKR and K-Star in a professional manner

 
#LI-OnsiteKKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
